intro: Columnea figueroae, commonly known as the Figueroa's flame. It is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. This species belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a trailing vine, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is glossy and dark green, complementing the striking red floral display.
